info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 9:17PM EDT until July 10 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall.
* WHERE...A portion of southern Delaware, including the following county, Sussex.
* WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 912 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms earlier in the evening. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. Water that remains on roadways will be slow to drain due to the high astronomical tide this evening. Please continue to heed remaining road closures. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Millville, Ocean View and South Bethany. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
